results.title: Towards community education
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R & R Film Productions
results.brief_description: Community education seeks to redefine the boundaries of “traditional” learning. This type of education encourages all members of the community to participate in a range of activities.

results.title: Towards Baruya manhood. Part 2. Village life II
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Village life of the Baruya tribe in the Eastern Highlands of New Guinea. Includes work on a new garden, making a scarecrow, a cassowary hunters’ dance, part of a healing ceremony, and women feeding their pigs.

results.title: Towards Baruya manhood. Part 1. Village life I
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The first of a series of nine films about Baruya village life, social organisation, and agriculture. The Baruya belong to the Anga group of tribes of the Eastern Highlands of New Guinea.

results.title: Towards a modern Europe: the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Explains and illustrates the transition from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including the principles of the new study and attitudes in art, architecture and scholarship

results.title: Towards 2000: Robots and Energy
results.brief_description: The Robots are Coming- More and more jobs are being taken over each year by the robots of the world. Most of the jobs are tedious, but the robots don’t seem to mind. “Energy”- The sun and the wind could supply us with most of our energy needs - pollution free. “Research Into Space”- The Americans and the Russians are showing the world that space has no boundaries but getting up there does present problems from time to time. “Other Changes”- Electronic bagpipes and a hotel room the size of a phone box - they are just two of the changes taking place right now.

results.title: Toward intimacy (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Debbie McGee, Nicole Hubert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A woman with a disability retains both her sexuality and her right to seek, develop and sustain a relationship with the partner of her choice. In this documentary, four disabled women from across Canada share their personal experiences and raise important issues including sexuality, self-esteem, stereotyping and parenting. It is their opportunity to say, “this is the way it is and not the way you think it is”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debbie McGee, Nicole Hubert and ONF | NFB

results.title: Toward emotional security
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology for Living”.
Aims to assist adolescents in understanding and controlling their emotions. Tells of an eighteen-year-old girl, faced with a decision involving her feelings for her parents and a young man. She recalls episodes from her early life in which love, fear and hate were not always controlled and is then able to make a decision that shows her emotional growth.
